Sheath border color: the border of the leaf sheath is dark, or with a narrow white edge
Sheath color: the leaf sheath is mainly black
Sheathes on older stems: the leaf sheathes persist in older stems
Cone tip shape: The tip of the spore cone is blunt
Spore form: the spores are green and spherical
Branch grooves: the interior of the grrove is C-shaped
Branches: there are branches off the main stem, but these branches are not branched
Length of branch section: the first internode of the branch is equal to or longer than the associated stem sheath
Stem color: the aerial stem color is green
the aerial stem color is pink to light brown
Stem cross-section: up to half of the stem diameter is occupied by the hollow central cavity
Stem differences: the vegetative and reproductive stems differ in appearance
Stem texture: the stem feels smooth or slightly rough
